verses.kjv: Why standest thou afar off, O LORD? why hidest thou thyself in times of trouble?
verses.ct: LORD, why do you stand so far away? Why do you seem absent during times of trouble?

verses.kjv: The wicked in his pride doth persecute the poor: let them be taken in the devices that they have imagined.
verses.ct: The wicked arrogantly hunt down the poor — let them be trapped by their own schemes.

verses.kjv: For the wicked boasteth of his heart’s desire, and blesseth the covetous, whom the LORD abhorreth.
verses.ct: The wicked person brags about what he craves, and he praises the greedy — the very people the LORD despises.

verses.kjv: The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek after God: God is not in all his thoughts.
verses.ct: The wicked person is too proud to look for God; God has no place in any of his thoughts.

verses.kjv: His ways are always grievous; thy judgments are far above out of his sight: as for all his enemies, he puffeth at them.
verses.ct: Everything he does brings pain to others; your judgments are too high for him to notice, and he sneers at all his enemies.

verses.kjv: He hath said in his heart, I shall not be moved: for I shall never be in adversity.
verses.ct: He tells himself, 'Nothing can shake me. I will never face hard times.'

verses.kjv: His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and fraud: under his tongue is mischief and vanity.
verses.ct: His mouth is loaded with curses, lies, and threats; trouble and evil lurk beneath his tongue.

verses.kjv: He sitteth in the lurking places of the villages: in the secret places doth he murder the innocent: his eyes are privily set against the poor.
verses.ct: He hides in ambush near the villages; from concealed spots he murders the innocent. His eyes secretly watch for the vulnerable.

verses.kjv: He lieth in wait secretly as a lion in his den: he lieth in wait to catch the poor: he doth catch the poor, when he draweth him into his net.
verses.ct: He lurks in hiding like a lion in its den; he waits to seize the poor. He catches the poor by dragging them into his trap.

verses.kjv: He croucheth, and humbleth himself, that the poor may fall by his strong ones.
verses.ct: He crouches low and makes himself small, so that the helpless fall into the grip of his strength.

verses.kjv: He hath said in his heart, God hath forgotten: he hideth his face; he will never see it.
verses.ct: He tells himself, 'God has forgotten. He has turned away and will never notice.'

verses.kjv: Arise, O LORD; O God, lift up thine hand: forget not the humble.
verses.ct: Rise up, LORD! God, raise your hand! Don't forget those who are suffering.

verses.kjv: Wherefore doth the wicked contemn God? he hath said in his heart, Thou wilt not require it.
verses.ct: Why does the wicked person show contempt for God? Because he tells himself, 'You will never hold me accountable.'

verses.kjv: Thou hast seen it; for thou beholdest mischief and spite, to requite it with thy hand: the poor committeth himself unto thee; thou art the helper of the fatherless.
verses.ct: But you do see it — you observe the trouble and the grief so that you can deal with it yourself. The helpless person entrusts himself to you; you are the one who defends the orphan.

verses.kjv: Break thou the arm of the wicked and the evil man: seek out his wickedness till thou find none.
verses.ct: Shatter the power of the wicked and evil person; pursue his wickedness until none of it remains.

verses.kjv: The LORD is King for ever and ever: the heathen are perished out of his land.
verses.ct: The LORD is King forever and ever; the nations that reject him will vanish from his land.

verses.kjv: LORD, thou hast heard the desire of the humble: thou wilt prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thine ear to hear:
verses.ct: LORD, you have heard the longing of the humble. You will strengthen their hearts, and you will listen closely,

verses.kjv: To judge the fatherless and the oppressed, that the man of the earth may no more oppress.
verses.ct: bringing justice to the orphan and the oppressed, so that mere mortals on earth will terrorize them no more.
